question: Thank you ! I have diabetes family history . My father was diagnosed  with diabetes when he was 47 years old and his father(my grandpa)was diagnosed when he was  57 or around 60 something.Now I am 29 years old  .I understood that I have   pre diabetes (fasting 5.2mmol(95mg) after lite breakfast 6.8 mmol(122 mg).  I felt happy when I read about pre diabetes , that it can be reversible and  I can become normal again. after managed to reduce my weight 8 kg with diet and exercise  , am well within ideal range for my height now.   My question is if i have family history of diabetes , does it mean that it is not in my hands to prevent developing diabetes ?. should it go this way ... I mean ..will it turn in to full fledged diabetes even if i take care of diet and physical activity?  .  how many years more i can be normal with this test results.  Thank you
title: family history of diabeties
